main event: On 27th October 1952, two commercial pilots on PAA flight witnessed a luminous green object at 11,300 feet, which entered a cloud at 5,000 feet and illuminated the cloud for 3 seconds.
interesting points: The object was observed falling rapidly towards the surface before entering a cumulus cloud at an estimated 5,000 feet elevation, where it illuminated the cloud for 3 seconds.
The pilots verified each other's observations, adding credibility to the sighting.
The object was of bright intensity and seemed to fall rapidly towards the surface before entering the cloud.
The weather at the time consisted of 2/3 cumulus bases at 2,000 feet and tops at 5,000 feet.
The source of the sighting was two commercial pilots, lending credibility to the report.
location: Port de France, vicinity of the Virgin Islands
